Description of incident: Two malware pieces were discovered on Energy Federation's server on July 12.  They appear to have been inserted on July 7 and July 10.  The purpose of the malware was to collect information on the server. Customer names, credit card numbers and expiration dates, and contact information could have been exposed.  At least 20 New Hampshire residents were affected by the breach, but the total number of affected customers nationwide was not revealed.
